results.title: Forests and conservation
results.brief_description: The critical problem of how to conserve and utilize the forest resources of USA. Selective logging, re-afforestation and fire-prevention are three of the most vital methods.

results.title: Foresters Island
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Portrays the development of the timber resources of Tasmania from the earliest settlement of the State through to the present day large-scale timber operations and the management of the resource by the State Forestry Commission.

results.title: Foresters
results.brief_description: There has been greater progress in the science of forestry during the past several decades than in any previous time, and it is the practitioner of the trade, the professional forester, whose day-to-day work is most responsible for making effective the discoveries, experiments and research carried on at forestry stations across Canada. This film shows both the modern technology of the timberlands and the role of the forester in the preservation and regeneration of this great natural resource.

results.title: Forest fire suppression [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Cherry, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Live action, animated sketches and maps are used to provide a detailed demonstration of how a forest fire is brought under control. The film describes the various factors - water supply, road transportation, type of timber stands, and direction of wind - which firefighters take into account in planning their attack and deploying equipment. It shows the actual fighting of a fire, and the mopping-up operations and close watch that must follow to safeguard against a renewed outbreak.

results.title: Forest dream
results.brief_description: An evocative look at man’s relationship with trees. The film creates an awareness of the sense of harmony between the age, warmth, texture, strength and beauty of forests and those related qualities we discover by exploring some of the products of wood.

results.title: Ford Australia: 75 years
results.creator_credit: Richard Cornish and Q Media Productions
results.brief_description: Geelong, July 1st 1925 and Australia’s first model T Ford rolled off a temporary production line. In the year 2000 the Ford Motor Company celebrated 75 years of continuous production in Australia. This video explores the Model T, the world’s first ute designed and built in Geelong, Fordson Tractors, the Customline, Ford GTs and many more through to the current model Ford AUII.

results.title: Forces: composition and resolution
results.brief_description: Defines forces as vector qualities and illustrates how components and resultants may be determined graphically. Shows the methods for finding both resultants and components in problems involving two or more forces acting at angles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Forbidden places: silent witness: forensic science
results.creator_credit: David McIlvride and Television Renaissance Inc
results.brief_description: Forensic science involves a multitude of other science related disciplines; dentistry, etymology, odontology, pathology and DNA testing to name but a few. This program takes a look at these areas and examines the techniques practitioners of these disciplines use, and have used sucessfully in real cases to solve crime. The “silent witness” of the title refers to the silent, but crucial body of evidence that has been collected. The video is accompanied by support notes which includes a glossary and suggested discussions and activities.

results.title: Forbidden marriages in the Holy Land [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Michel Khleifi, Jerusalem Film Institute, Peace Media Programme of the European Union, Sindibad Films and Sourat Films
results.brief_description: This is a portrayal of the various kinds of mixed marriages ranging across different generations and social classes between the Arabs and Jews of Palestine/Israel and how the couples involved have dealt with the difficult problems that confront them in today’s tense environment. Not only is there the complication of Jew marrying Arab, but religion, whether it be Islam, Christian or Judaism plays a central role in all their lives. For example, it is forbidden for Muslim women to marry Jewish men, but a Muslim man is allowed to marry a Jewish woman if she converts to Islam. In Judaism it is forbidden to marry outside the religion, Christians are against mixed marriages and Islam although condoning marriage by Muslim men with Jews or Christians do not condone marriage with Buddhists, Hindus or atheists. All the couples interviewed in this documentary have gone against the social, political and religious norms but in their personal narratives we see the human side of the Arab-Israeli conflict, the pain of being ex-communicated from unaccepting family and friends, of children growing up not knowing their grandparents, and of bitter prejudices of religious and racial intolerances. But the over-riding factor is the love and respect for each other and each other’s culture and religion. Along with the couples’ stories we are also given an insight to the religious point of view through leaders from each of the respective faiths, Islam, Christian and Judaism. Director, Michel Khleifi, through this film points out the urgent need for the Middle East to bring in a civil code of marriage which will liberate the individual from all religious constraints, from the three monotheistic faiths, and allow a freedom of choice. In Arabic and Hebrew with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michel Khleifi, Jerusalem Film Institute, Peace Media Programme of the European Union, Sindibad Films and Sourat Films

In Arabic and Hebrew with English subtitles.

Not only is there the complication of Jew marrying Arab, but religion, whether it be Islam, Christian or Judaism plays a central role in all their lives. For example, it is forbidden for Muslim women to marry Jewish men, but a Muslim man is allowed to marry a Jewish woman if she converts to Islam. In Judaism it is forbidden to marry outside the religion, Christians are against mixed marriages and Islam although condoning marriage by Muslim men with Jews or Christians do not condone marriage with Buddhists, Hindus or atheists. All the couples interviewed in this documentary have gone against the social, political and religious norms but in their personal narratives we see the human side of the Arab-Israeli conflict, the pain of being ex-communicated from unaccepting family and friends, of children growing up not knowing their grandparents, and of bitter prejudices of religious and racial intolerances. But the over-riding factor is the love and respect for each other and each other’s culture and religion. Along with the couples’ stories we are also given an insight to the religious point of view through leaders from each of the respective faiths, Islam, Christian and Judaism. Director, Michel Khleifi, through this film points out the urgent need for the Middle East to bring in a civil code of marriage which will liberate the individual from all religious constraints, from the three monotheistic faiths, and allow a freedom of choice. In Arabic and Hebrew with English subtitles.

results.title: Forbidden city: the great within
results.creator_credit: Mick Kaczorowski, Discovery Channel, Maroon Production and Totem Films
results.brief_description: The Emperors of China conquered the world and then locked it out. Cinematographer, Zhao Fei, takes his cameras into the inner sanctums of the Forbidden City, to explore the private world of emperors, concubines and eunuchs, who lived in palaces with lavish gardens and temples. Re-creations based on Imperial archives and rare manuscripts create a fascinating portrait of a way of life and tradition hidden for hundreds of years. Narrated by Rod Steiger.
